Module com.example.loginpage
Package com.example.loginpage.module.users.typeofuser.typeOfClient

Class BannedClient

java.lang.Object
com.example.loginpage.module.users.User
com.example.loginpage.module.users.typeofuser.Client
com.example.loginpage.module.users.typeofuser.typeOfClient.BannedClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
FavouritesObserver, Serializable
public class BannedClient extends Client
Represents a customer who has been banned from making purchases. This class extends Client to add functionality specific to dealing with banned customers, including the ability to track the reason for the ban and whether the ban is permanent.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BannedClient

      public BannedClient(String name, String email, String phone, String password, String reasonForBan, boolean isPermanentlyBanned)
      Constructs a new BannedClient with detailed user information, the reason for the ban, and its permanency status. Initializes the client as non-admin by default.
      Parameters:
      name - The full name of the client.
      email - The email address of the client.
      phone - The phone number of the client.
      password - The password for the client's account.
      reasonForBan - The reason why the client is banned.
      isPermanentlyBanned - A boolean flag indicating whether the ban is permanent.

  • Method Details

    • purchaseBook

      public void purchaseBook(Book book)
      Overrides the purchaseBook method to deny purchase attempts, providing feedback that the client is banned.
      Overrides:
      purchaseBook in class Client
      Parameters:
      book - The book that the client attempts to purchase.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the BannedClient, appending "(Banned)" to the standard client representation.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Client
      Returns:
      A string representation of the BannedClient including the banned status.

    • isPermanentlyBanned

      public boolean isPermanentlyBanned()
      Checks if the ban on the client is permanent.
      Returns:
      true if the ban is permanent, otherwise false.

    • setPermanentlyBanned

      public void setPermanentlyBanned(boolean permanentlyBanned)
      Sets the permanency of the client's ban.
      Parameters:
      permanentlyBanned - A boolean indicating the new permanency status of the ban.
